body:
> @rsundqvist Have you seen [paramiko/paramiko#395](https://github.com/paramiko/paramiko/issues/395)?

Yes, saw it when googling. There may be two separate issues at play here, but I did not see any deadlocks running the old version whereas it happened 100% of the time running `1.24` except when the paramiko issue showed up.

We've had a lot of issues with paramiko in general but I don't recall seeing this particular error before. I couldn't reliably reproduce the issue running `paramiko==2.10.3`.
@rsundqvist Thanks for the reply. Can you create a reproducible example (e.g. by using docker compose)?

Could not use that command:
```console
ricsun@the-machine:~/git/repo-that-uses-mlflow$ pip install git+https://github.com/harupy/mlflow/commits/issue-5656
Defaulting to user installation because normal site-packages is not writeable
Looking in indexes: <company private index>, https://pypi.python.org/simple
Collecting git+https://github.com/harupy/mlflow/commits/issue-5656
  Cloning https://github.com/harupy/mlflow/commits/issue-5656 to /tmp/pip-req-build-hgv857xx
  Running command git clone -q https://github.com/harupy/mlflow/commits/issue-5656 /tmp/pip-req-build-hgv857xx
  fatal: repository 'https://github.com/harupy/mlflow/commits/issue-5656/' not found
```
Using `pip install git+https://github.com/harupy/mlflow.git@issue-5656` did the trick though, giving `1.24.1.dev0` which is what I would expect looking at your branch.

@harupy Doesn't seem to work unfortunately. Deadlocks in the same place.

> @rsundqvist Thanks for the reply. Can you create a reproducible example (e.g. by using docker compose)?

I'll see what I can do.

> @rsundqvist Sorry for the wrong command, I fixed it.
> 
> > I'll see what I can do.
> 
> Thank you!

Looked into this. The issue seems to be that the paramiko SFTP client is not thread safe which causes a deadlock. The `SFTPArtifactRepository` class probably needs a connection pool to support multithreading.

I've tested this a bit and it seems you can "corrupt" a `pysftp.Connection` by continously triggering multi-threaded downloads. Once in a bad state the error we discussed above is thrown even if trying to fetch "correctly" from a single thread.
@rsundqvist Thank you for diagnosing this! Would you be able to introduce a connection pool to `SFTPArtifactRepository` to address this issue?
